hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Parabolic Rise & Volume Disparity
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when BTC rallies >40% in 14 days with declining volume trend (price/volume divergence) and funding rates exceed +0.05% (annualized), a break below the parabolic SAR indicator will signal imminent transition to STRESS regime with sharp correction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Parabolic moves on declining volume suggest weak participation. High funding rates indicate excessive leverage. The break below parabolic SAR (trend-following indicator) often triggers cascading liquidations as leveraged longs get stopped out.
entry_conditions: 5-day volume SMA < 20-day volume SMA (declining volume trend)
BTC closes below daily parabolic SAR

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price decline from entry OR regime shifts to STRESS

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals see price recover to new highs within 7 days (failed transitions) OR fail to trigger >10% correction within 5 trading days.
